accounts.name: delegation_owner
docs: extra checks

accounts.name: clock
docs: We don't need this account to actually derive the PDA, since we check
that the node is the correct one that the primary acc is associated to

accounts.name: new_delegator
docs: checks

accounts.name: new_withdrawer
docs: checks

accounts.name: primary
docs: comparing it to the delegation target inside the instruction code.

types.name: ActivatingStake
docs: The stake account that is being activated/deactivated. i64 since we can deactivate stake.
Hard coded size of the array because Anchor can't handle vars or consts for sizes,
only literal numerics

types.name: ClockAccount
docs: An account storing the current network epoch

fields.name: stake
docs: stake amount in this account

fields.name: stake_index
docs: Stake index in the stake queue of the primary account we're delegated to

fields.name: claimed_rewards
docs: whether the rewards for this stake for the period between
activation and deactivation have been claimed

types.name: DelegationMasterAccount
docs: Tracks the offsets of the [DelegatedStakingAccount]s over which a user has authority.
# Note
We cap the number of accounts to [MAX_STAKE_ACCOUNTS] (which is set to 128 for now, but this can
be increased if necessary).

types.name: Epoch
docs: The network epoch

fields.name: activation_epoch
docs: epoch at which the stake was activated. Epoch::MAX if inactive.

fields.name: unlock_epoch
docs: epoch from which on active stake can be deactivated. Epoch::MAX if inactive

fields.name: deactivation_epoch
docs: epoch the stake was deactivated, Epoch::MAX if still active

types.name: OwnedStakingAccReference
docs: Reference to a delegated staking account owned by the user

fields.name: primary_stake
docs: Primary stake amount in this account that is less than the
stake mandated by the hw capacity of the associated node

fields.name: excess_primary_stake
docs: Primary stake amount in this account that is more than the
stake mandated by the hw capacity of the associated node
(i.e. rewards get applied w sublinear curve)

fields.name: new_cu_claim
docs: Optional new cu claim to be activated at the end of the epoch

types.name: RentClaimMap
docs: Maintains a list of rent claims for a given offset. Is always sorted by offset.
Workaround because Anchor doesn't support BTreeMaps/HashMaps yet.

types.name: RewardBatch
docs: The reason this type exists is we mostly use RewardClaim as the input for leaves in the
MerkleTree. These leaves have to have a certain constant batching rate. Unfortunately Anchor
doesn't support defining array length based on a variable or constant for inputs, it has to be a
numeric. To avoid having to manually check everywhere we submit a batch of RewardClaims, we
define this type to have it in one place where we can apply our assert_size macro to make sure
it doesn't deviate from our defined constant using cargo test.
Other note: A simpler way to define this type would be
`type RewardBatch = [RewardClaim; 1];` but Anchor at runtime
thinks any RewardBatch it is all zeroes for whatever reason, so we do this.

fields.name: index_within_hw
docs: All stakes at the indices until and including this one are considered to be within the
hardware requirements of the node.

fields.name: hw_stake_index
docs: Index until which the stake is under or equal to the requirement of the node hardware
